column3: who now works for Tom Brady in Las Vegas
column4: Licht may lose his other trusted colleague. Assistant general manager Mike Greenberg is now a target of the Jags to become their next general manager alongside new Jags chief football czar Tony Boselli
column5: the Hall of Fame offensive lineman. Peter Schrager of NFL Network reported the Jags asked the Bucs for permission to interview Greenberg. This is a tough one for Licht. He’s tight with Greenberg and wants to see Greenberg get a chance to run a team. But that one? Jacksonville? That would hurt. The Jags twice last week tied to interview Bucs assistant coaches and both times the Jags got shot down by Tampa Bay. Teams cannot block employees from interviewing for promotions. Tough one. Jags owner Shad Con Khan said new Jags head coach Liam Coen
column6: Boselli and the next general manager will “form a football leadership unit that will collaborate and align on all major football decisions

column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/02/todd-bowles-to-emphasize-third-down-defense-in-2025/|Todd Bowles To Emphasize Third Down Defense In 2025|This may really surprise Bucs fans but not even Todd Bowles will be happy with this. The Bucs coach
column2: in his final media availability of the 2024 season the day after the Bucs lost to Washington
column3: was very focused on one element of his defense that didn’t get the job done. Third down defense. And despite Bowles rightly being irked
column4: the Bucs weren’t horrendous on third downs if you look at the season in the big picture. In the small picture (playoff loss to Washington)
column5: it was atrocious. The Bucs never forced one punt in the playoff loss to Washington. Not one! The Bucs did get off the field on two fourth-downs when Washington couldn’t convert. Still
column6: it was a playoff game and your opposing punter could have just stayed home or sat with Bucs fans and pounded beers in the south end zone
column7: that’s inexcusable. Bowles all but vowed that will change this fall. “It’s doing the little things right – not turning the ball over
column8: getting off the field on third down
column9: ” Bowles said of what must change in 2025. “Those are the little things that happened all year that came up at the end. We had a good stretch defensively at playing third downs – didn’t play them well [against Washington].” In 2024
column10: the Bucs finished in the middle of the pack in third down defense holding opponents to a 39 percent conversion percentage. That was good/bad enough for 15th place. It would help if Bowles can somehow
column12: bite the bullet and come to grips with the fact that the Bucs cannot succeed in the postseason without an effective edge rusher. column15: ""post"": ""Bucs simply do not have the players on defense to stop better teams on 3rd or even 4th downs.  I\u2019d like the Bucs to go back to a 4-3 defense and get two big strong real DE type edge rushers.  Bucs also need shutdown CBs that are durable.""

column42: ""post"": ""In my opinion the traditional 4-3 and 3-4 defensive schemes are becoming obsolete as the NFL evolves. The future lies in a nickel or dime hybrid defense
column43: featuring an extra safety/cornerback hybrid (big enough to be a lb but runs like a corner) capable of covering a Travis Kelce or stopping a Saquon Barkley
column44: all while maintaining the ability to spy the quarterback on third or fourth down. In today\u2019s NFL
column45: it\u2019s all about speed in space\u2014creating mismatches through motion and exploiting coverage gaps created by stacking receivers and moving the pocket. This approach stretches zone coverage and makes man-to-man coverage nearly impossible to execute effectively. This is just what I see as a fan and based on which teams seem to win week in and out.""

column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/02/mina-kimes-bucs-offense-will-make-josh-grizzard-look-good/|Mina Kimes: Bucs Offense Will Make Josh Grizzard Look Good|Joe has written a couple of times — half-jokingly
column2: half-serious — wondering where new Bucs offensive coordinator Josh Grizzard will be a head coach next year. The last three Bucs offensive coordinators have experienced extremes in their careers the last three seasons. Either the offensive coordinator has had his arse canned and can’t find another job or he’s been hired as a head coach. Nothing in-between. Feast or famine. BSPN football analyst Mina Kimes
column3: on her podcast last week recorded just hours before Grizzard was promoted
column4: noted whomever got the job would look good because there are no weak spots on the offense (provided the Bucs bring back Chris Godwin). “It’s like the perfect job for a coordinator to get a lot of credit
column5: because it’s like a good offensive line
column6: a quarterback that people think is good — not great
column7: really good. “We’ll see with Chris Godwin. That’s an interesting one
column8: but Jalen McMillian was really awesome for them. Bucky Irving was awesome. Mike Evans is still Mike Evans
column9: so I’m not worried about the offense.” Nor should Bucs fans. Joe believes now that Bucky Irving has a year of NFL under his belt
column10: he will be better. Joe doesn’t think the same expectation is wrong for Jalen McMillan. He should be better. Grizzard will be learning on the job
column11: just like Dave Canales did in 2023. Canales’ two biggest problems were scoring a touchdown on the opening drive — just the opposite of Liam Coen — and Canales was way too hung up on running up the middle time and again. And still Canales had the Bucs a play and a two-point conversation from pushing the mighty Lions to overtime in the playoffs. Kimes isn’t wrong. The offense should still be good. The offense has the players to bail out Grizzard if he makes some errors. The defense

column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/02/mike-evans-details-one-reason-why-josh-grizzard-will-succeed/|Mike Evans Details One Reason Josh Grizzard Will Succeed|Roughly a week before Christmas
column2: then-Bucs offensive coordinator Liam Coen told the NFL world that the success of the Bucs on third downs was largely because of one man. The Bucs led the NFL in third down conversions
column3: which is a tremendous feat. Coen said look no further than passing game coordinator Josh Grizzard. Coen explained Grizzard’s sphere of influence was crafting third-down plays. And the reason the Bucs did so well on those plays is because Grizzard knows what he is doing. Yesterday at the Pro Bowl practice
column4: Mike Evans explained that is why he believes Grizzard will have success as the Bucs’ new offensive coordinator. “Very big point of emphasis — obviously Josh did the third down meetings last year
column5: ” Evans said. “We were very locked in to the games [as a result of] those third down meetings. We knew what was coming.” So
column7: the Bucs similarly will be locked in not just on third downs
column8: but all downs this fall. Joe didn’t get the impression the Bucs weren’t locked in on first and second downs. But it seems like the Bucs were laser-focused on third downs. And a large reason
